newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Aznar says cannot meet some budget demands.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Aznar says cannot meet some budget demands.

text.p: Spanish Prime Minister Jose Maria Aznar told Spanish radio on Wednesday that not all health spending demands could be met with the 1997 budget draft.
"We can't address all needs, for example those of the autonomous communities," Aznar told Radio Ser.
The ruling Popular Party's Catalan allies have tied their approval of the budget to earmarking 32 billion pesetas from the central government for its health budget.
Aznar said the health budget is projected to grow six percent according to the budget draft, while overall budget expenditure will not grow by more than two percent.
